body.p: A page break will be created each time there is a change in the page property associated to the elements in a sequence. Consider you have a sequence of div elements, one of them associated with a "cover" page, others with a "content" page:

body.p: There will be a forced page break between the first div and the second, because of the page change. breaks also the page between the two div elements with class "content". Although not respecting the CSS specification, it makes easier to implement page breaks for a technical book. You could have a "chapter" page associate to a sequence of elements. There will be no need for additional page-break-before properties.
